item.title: Overview of ChatGPT and DevOps use cases
item.description:
What is ChatGPT?

  • GPT (Generative Pretrained Transformer) is a type of natural language processing (NLP) model developed by OpenAI. It is a large, powerful model that can generate human-like text based on the input it receives.
  • It is optimized for generating responses to user input in a conversational context, and it can be trained on specific domains

What is the significane of it?

¬†

  • Sam Altman, the CEO and founder of OpenAI, recently announced the official release of the openGPT one week earlier(on November 30).
  • Currently, the service is free. It might be turned to a paid service because, according to Sam, the average cost each chat is only a few cents.
  • The number of users has now surpassed 1 million, and it only took 5 days from debut to accomplish this. Instagram took 2.5 months, Facebook 10 months, and Netflix 48 months.

Is it useful for me?

  • Oh, Yeah! No matter whatever field you are on. ChatGPT is genius tool in many ways!

The results I’m seeing from ChatGPT makes me appreciate humans even more, especially those who think critically, and continue to push the boundaries on creative expression. ChatGPT feels like the baseline of what we are capable of and sets the bar so we can raise it.

item.title: Jenkins Pipeline
item.description:
What is Jenkins Pipeline ü§î

  • Jenkins Pipeline allows us to write the Jenkins build steps in code
  • Pipelines are robust. So if your server undergoes an unpredicted restart, the pipeline will be automatically resumed.
  • Jenkins Pipelines support big projects. You can run many jobs, and even use pipelines in a loop

Jenkins Pipeline format

Jenkins Pipeline can be defined by a text file called JenkinsFile. You can implement pipeline as code using JenkinsFile, and this can be defined by using a DSL (Domain Specific Language).

Proxy is an act where someelse doing something for you on your behalf.

What is Proxy server?

It is a server that sits in front of a group of client machines. When those computers make requests to sites and services on the Internet, the proxy server intercepts those requests and then communicates with web servers on behalf of those clients, like a middleman.

item.title: Kubectl alias
item.description:
Play with kubernets at ease!

Alias? What,Why ü§î

  • An alias is a (usually short) name that the shell translates into another (usually longer) name or command. Aliases allow you to define new commands by substituting a string for the first token of a simple command.
  • It can be used to avoid typing long commands or as a means to correct incorrect input. For common patterns it can reduce keystrokes and improve efficiency. A simple example is setting default options on commands to avoid having to type them each time a command is run

item.title: AWS EKS Deployment through terraform
item.description:
What is the significance of this?

  • Using this repository, you can provision the application as well as all of your cloud infrastructure with a single command.

How is automation accomplished?

  • Terraform has been used to provision infrastructure on AWS.
  • To make provision for application On the AWS EKS, deployment has been performed through using Helm template.
  • To fit the Kubernetes design, the NodeJS service has been changed to a microservice.
  • Terraform has been converted into a docker container microservice to improve team cooperation by ensuring that everyone uses the same version of the software.
  • This project makes use of Makefile to automate the provisioning of the full stack with a single command.
  • For convenience of usage, the load and performance testing tool locust has been transformed into a docker container.

Prerequisite

  • AWS account access
  • AWS iam programmatic user access with the follwing policy attached to the user
  • AmazonEC2FullAccess,IAMFullAccess,AutoScalingFullAccess,AmazonEKSClusterPolicy, ¬† ¬† Ôøº
  • AmazonEKSWorkerNodePolicy,AmazonVPCFullAccess,AmazonEKSServicePolicy,AmazonEKS_CNI_Policy

Source Code

https://github.com/Lforlinux/aws-terraform-nodejs

How to provision the infra

Makefile has been leveraged for the simple approach towards the one-click entire stack deployment.
